results.title: Systemic Oxidative Stress and Visceral Adipose Tissue Mediators of NLRP3 Inflammasome and Autophagy Are Reduced in Obese Type 2 Diabetic Patients Treated with Metformin
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were clustered into two groups: @<m>DISEASE_Obesity_Metabolically_Benign</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067329 @@@MHO@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Abad-Jiménez Z, López-Domènech S, Díaz-Rúa R, Iannantuoni F, Gómez-Abril SÁ, Periañez-Gómez D, Morillas C, Víctor VM, Rocha M. Systemic Oxidative Stress and Visceral Adipose Tissue Mediators of NLRP3 Inflammasome and Autophagy Are Reduced in Obese Type 2 Diabetic Patients Treated with Metformin Antioxidants (Basel). 2020 Sep 21;9(9):. results.title: Preliminary report of hypoglycemic response in obese metabolic syndrome males treated with metformin after weight loss intervention.
results.text_hl: Preliminary report of hypoglycemic response in @<m>DISEASE_Obesity_Metabolically_Benign</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067329 @@@obese metabolic syndrome@@@ males treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ after @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@weight loss@@@ intervention.

results.title: Menopausal obesity and metabolic syndrome - PolSenior study.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with CVD risk factors the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy is a golden standard.
